item.title: Two men suspected in New York cryptocurrency kidnapping torture case released on million-dollar bailTwo suspects, John Woeltz and William Duplessie, accused of kidnapping and abusing a Bitcoin investor in New York, were granted bail on Wednesday for $1.00M each. Despite facing charges that could lead to life imprisonment, the judge stated that the credibility of witnesses and discrepancies in the narratives of both sides in the case led to the decision to grant bail. Prosecutors allege that the two men subjected an Italian businessman to two weeks of violent coercion, including electric shocks, beatings, and death threats, with the aim of obtaining crypto assets. The defense claims that the so-called "victim" was not forcibly detained and submitted videos of him participating in social activities as evidence. Casa Security stated that it has tracked 30 similar incidents in the first half of 2025 alone, calling on crypto holders to strengthen their physical security. [Decrypt]

item.title: Solana Foundation and ecosystem partners jointly release "Internet Capital Market" roadmapThe Solana Foundation, Anza, Jito Labs, DoubleZero, Drift, and Multicoin Capital leaders have co-authored a roadmap for the "Internet Capital Markets." It proposes application-controlled execution (ACE) as the core direction for future evolution, with the goal of creating the next generation of decentralized, high-performance financial infrastructure. The roadmap points out that the biggest challenge currently lies in market microstructure optimization, with ACE allowing smart contracts to control transaction sequencing with millisecond-level precision. In the long-term plan, Solana will implement an MCL (multi-leader parallel proposal) architecture to break through the "single proposer bottleneck," improve censorship resistance, and achieve global market synchronization. [CoinDesk]

Anchorage Digital to issue first GENIUS‚Äëcompliant stablecoin in US with Ethena LabsAnchorage Digital, the first federally chartered crypto bank in the United States, will issue Ethena Labs‚Äô USDtb token onshore as the first stablecoin engineered to comply with the new GENIUS Act, the companies said on Thursday.
Ethena‚Äôs USDtb is a yield-bearing dollar token primarily backed by BlackRock‚Äôs BUIDL and crypto collateral rather than traditional reserves to maintain its $1 peg. The synthetic stablecoin has circulated offshore since December and amassed $1.45 billion in total value locked, according to DefiLlama data.
Under the partnership, Anchorage Digital Bank will mint and redeem USDtb tokens directly in the U.S., bringing the asset under a federal regulatory umbrella for the first time. Anchorage said its stablecoin issuance platform will serve as a turnkey infrastructure for Ethena‚Äôs stablecoin to ‚Äúlaunch and distribute fully regulated digital dollars.‚Äù
The move comes one week after President Donald Trump signed the GENIUS Act, the country‚Äôs first law governing stablecoin issuance. Industry players and U.S. officials like Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent expect the legislation to accelerate demand from asset managers, payments firms, and corporates looking for yield‚Äëbearing, programmable dollars.
The passage of GENIUS gives federally regulated institutions a green light and clarity to participate in the stablecoin ecosystem, Anchorage CEO Nathan‚ÄØMcCauley noted in the release.
Guy Young, Ethena Labs CEO, added that products like USDtb stand to benefit from federal oversight and regulated appetite. ‚ÄúWhile we‚Äôve already seen strong demand for USDtb, we expect GENIUS compliance to empower our partners and holders to confidently and significantly expand its use across new products and platforms,‚Äù he said.
Anchorage‚Äôs announcement positions it alongside giants such as Circle and PayPal, which already operate dollar‚Äëpegged tokens but must adapt to GENIUS requirements. Major banks like JPMorganand Citihave flagged plans to experiment with stablecoins and deposit‚Äëbacked tokens once the rules settle. [companies]
